sentence.Network_en: After the fire, all that was left was the burned - out shell of the building.
sentence.Network_cn: 大火以后所剩下的就是被烧焦的建筑物的外壳了.

sentence.Network_en: The light bulb in the bathroom burned out and father put in a new one.
sentence.Network_cn: 洗澡间里的灯泡烧坏了,父亲装上一只新的.

sentence.Network_en: By five o'clock in the afternoon we were all burned out from working.
sentence.Network_cn: 到了下午5点,我们已经干得筋疲力竭了.

means.word_mean: 1. exhausted as a result of long-time stress;
2. inoperative as a result of heat or friction;
3. destroyed or badly damaged by fire;
